TextBlock.Text: CASSAVA: I am still unable to comprehend what has transpired.. But I must focus on what I can now.
CASSAVA: Studying what I can to comprehend its nature is the only thing I can do now.

CASSAVA: The substance appears unable to be perceived by ordinary sight, but can be detected by the third eye. It.. it is overwhelming in its abundance, such that I must close my third eye to see the world clearly.
CASSAVA: But even with such cacophony, I can detect higher concentrations of the matter along the ground of the island, and along the artificial gravity walkways of the Construction Yard.
CASSAVA: This implies the matter does <color=orange>obey gravity, both from natural and artificial sources.</color>
CASSAVA: If this hypothesis is true, much of the matter should be drawn over time into the local star, as the gravitational center of the system - as well as Giant's Deep, owing to its great mass.
CASSAVA: But if that is the case, I wonder: could an entity with stronger gravitational energy be able to <color=orange>competitively influence</color> this deadly matter?
